verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Command the children of Israel, that they put out of the camp every leper, and every one that hath an issue, and whosoever is defiled by the dead:
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites to send away from the camp anyone with a skin disease, anyone with a bodily discharge, and anyone who has become unclean by contact with a dead body.

verses.kjv: Both male and female shall ye put out, without the camp shall ye put them; that they defile not their camps, in the midst whereof I dwell.
verses.ct: Send away both men and women — put them outside the camp so they don't make the camp unclean, since I live among you there."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did so, and put them out without the camp: as the LORD spake unto Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The Israelites did this and sent those people outside the camp. They carried out exactly what the LORD had told Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, When a man or woman shall commit any sin that men commit, to do a trespass against the LORD, and that person be guilty;
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: When a man or woman wrongs another person in any way, that person has been unfaithful to the LORD and is guilty.

verses.kjv: Then they shall confess their sin which they have done: and he shall recompense his trespass with the principal thereof, and add unto it the fifth part thereof, and give it unto him against whom he hath trespassed.
verses.ct: They must confess the sin they committed. Then they must pay back the full amount they owe for the wrong, plus an additional 20 percent, and give it to the person they wronged.

verses.kjv: But if the man have no kinsman to recompense the trespass unto, let the trespass be recompensed unto the LORD, even to the priest; beside the ram of the atonement, whereby an atonement shall be made for him.
verses.ct: But if that person has no relatives to receive the payment, the restitution goes to the LORD — meaning it goes to the priest — along with the ram of atonement, through which atonement will be made for the guilty person.

verses.kjv: And every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring unto the priest, shall be his.
verses.ct: Every sacred contribution that the Israelites bring to the priest will belong to him.

verses.kjv: And every man’s hallowed things shall be his: whatsoever any man giveth the priest, it shall be his.
verses.ct: Each person's sacred gifts belong to them, but whatever someone gives to the priest becomes the priest's."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man’s wife go aside, and commit a trespass against him,
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: Suppose a man's wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him.

verses.kjv: And a man lie with her carnally, and it be hid from the eyes of her husband, and be kept close, and she be defiled, and there be no witness against her, neither she be taken with the manner;
verses.ct: Suppose another man has had relations with her, but it was hidden from her husband and kept secret. She has made herself impure, but there is no witness against her, and she was not caught in the act.

verses.kjv: And the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be defiled: or if the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be not defiled:
verses.ct: If a feeling of jealousy comes over the husband and he suspects his wife, whether she has actually made herself impure or not —

verses.kjv: Then shall the man bring his wife unto the priest, and he shall bring her offering for her, the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal; he shall pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon; for it is an offering of jealousy, an offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
verses.ct: then the husband must bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring an offering on her behalf: one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He must not pour oil on it or add frankincense to it, because this is a jealousy offering, a grain offering meant to bring wrongdoing to light.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall bring her near, and set her before the LORD:
verses.ct: The priest will bring the woman forward and have her stand in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel; and of the dust that is in the floor of the tabernacle the priest shall take, and put it into the water:
verses.ct: Then the priest will take holy water in a clay jar and mix in some dust from the floor of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall set the woman before the LORD, and uncover the woman’s head, and put the offering of memorial in her hands, which is the jealousy offering: and the priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that causeth the curse:
verses.ct: The priest will have the woman stand in the LORD's presence, loosen her hair, and place the memorial offering — the jealousy offering — in her hands. The priest himself will hold the bitter water that brings a curse.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall charge her by an oath, and say unto the woman, If no man have lain with thee, and if thou hast not gone aside to uncleanness with another instead of thy husband, be thou free from this bitter water that causeth the curse:
verses.ct: Then the priest will put her under oath and say to the woman, 'If no man has had relations with you, and if you have not gone astray and made yourself impure while married to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse have no effect on you.

verses.kjv: But if thou hast gone aside to another instead of thy husband, and if thou be defiled, and some man have lain with thee beside thine husband:
verses.ct: But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and made yourself impure — if some man other than your husband has had relations with you —'

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest shall say unto the woman, The LORD make thee a curse and an oath among thy people, when the LORD doth make thy thigh to rot, and thy belly to swell;
verses.ct: at this point the priest will put the woman under a sworn curse and say to her, 'May the LORD make you an example of cursing among your people, when the LORD causes your body to waste away and your abdomen to swell.

verses.kjv: And this water that causeth the curse shall go into thy bowels, to make thy belly to swell, and thy thigh to rot: And the woman shall say, Amen, amen.
verses.ct: May this water that brings a curse enter your body, causing your abdomen to swell and your body to waste away.' The woman must respond, 'So be it, so be it.'

verses.kjv: And the priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall blot them out with the bitter water:
verses.ct: The priest will write these curses on a scroll and then wash the writing off into the bitter water.

verses.kjv: And he shall cause the woman to drink the bitter water that causeth the curse: and the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, and become bitter.
verses.ct: He will have the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water will enter her and become bitter inside her.

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall take the jealousy offering out of the woman’s hand, and shall wave the offering before the LORD, and offer it upon the altar:
verses.ct: The priest will take the jealousy offering from the woman's hands, lift it up before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take an handful of the offering, even the memorial thereof, and burn it upon the altar, and afterward shall cause the woman to drink the water.
verses.ct: The priest will take a handful of the offering as the memorial portion and burn it on the altar. After that, he will have the woman drink the water.

verses.kjv: And when he hath made her to drink the water, then it shall come to pass, that, if she be defiled, and have done trespass against her husband, that the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, and become bitter, and her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall rot: and the woman shall be a curse among her people.
verses.ct: Once he has made her drink the water, if she has made herself impure and been unfaithful to her husband, the water that brings a curse will enter her and become bitter. Her abdomen will swell and her body will waste away, and she will become an example of cursing among her people.

verses.kjv: And if the woman be not defiled, but be clean; then she shall be free, and shall conceive seed.
verses.ct: But if the woman has not made herself impure and is innocent, she will be cleared and will be able to become pregnant.

verses.kjv: This is the law of jealousies, when a wife goeth aside to another instead of her husband, and is defiled;
verses.ct: This is the procedure for cases of jealousy, when a wife goes astray and makes herself impure while married to her husband,

verses.kjv: Or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon him, and he be jealous over his wife, and shall set the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute upon her all this law.
verses.ct: or when a feeling of jealousy comes over a husband and he suspects his wife. He is to bring her before the LORD, and the priest will carry out this entire procedure with her.

verses.kjv: Then shall the man be guiltless from iniquity, and this woman shall bear her iniquity.
verses.ct: The husband will be free from guilt, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin."
